### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.dexerto.com/pokemon/pokemon-go-research-breakthrough-tasks-1545588/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dexerto.com%2Fpokemon%2Fpokemon-go-research-breakthrough-tasks-1545588%2F) ### Comment > AdGuard is recognized by the website. comment.body:
> At first check the rule is not breaking normal content (Most read only found as a popup).
> 
> Did you find any other places such section is included?

I checked on desktop and mobile and the request is made on both platforms after scrolling ~1vh. It's unused on desktop, while on mobile it's only used for the popup.

The "most read" section on the sidebar is unaffected as it is part of the html sent by the server.

labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=989Tc4OFtTs](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3D989Tc4OFtTs) ### Comment > After activating my 12-month student subscription, I am unable to watch any videos on the YouTube website when using the Microsoft Edge browser. Every single video I attempt to play immediately shows the error message: "Video unavailable. This content isn't available, try again later."This issue seems to be isolated to the Microsoft Edge browser on my computer. I can confirm that videos play correctly on other browsers (like Google Chrome) and on the YouTube mobile app on my phone.To resolve this, I have already tried the following troubleshooting steps without any success:Clearing the entire cache, cookies, and browsing history in Microsoft Edge.Disabling all browser extensions to check for conflicts.Ensuring Microsoft Edge is fully updated to the latest version.Restarting my computer and my internet router.As a paying subscriber, I expect the service to be fully functional on a major, supported browser like Microsoft Edge. ### Screenshots

> 
> ```
> [$domain=/^prime\.[^.]+\.[a-z]/]#$#form[id][style^="display:"] { display: block !important; }
> [$path=/rinku/land/]#%#//scriptlet('trusted-click-element', 'form > center > button[class^="btn-"]')
> [$path=/rinku/land/]###delulu-overlay
> [$domain=/^prime\.[^.]+\.[a-z]/]#%#//scriptlet('prevent-element-src-loading', 'script', '/detectIncognito.min.js')
> [$domain=/^prime\.[^.]+\.[a-z]/]##center:has(div[class^="container"] > div[class^="ad"])
> [$domain=/^prime\.[^.]+\.[a-z]/]###desktop-ad-container
> [$domain=/^prime\.[^.]+\.[a-z]/]##div[class^="horizontal-wrapper"]:has(> div[class^="ad-container"])

Nope I still have the same issue.

issue.body: ### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard for Windows ### AdGuard version * ### What type of problem have you encountered? Missed analytics or tracker ### Which browser(s) do you use? Brave ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? https://www.hulu.com ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy _No response_ ### Social Widgets _No response_ ### Annoyances _No response_ ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots im sure you know what ingest means as far as analytics but ill paste it just in case because i didn't know data ingestion is analytics til recently. : https://plainsignal.com/glossary/data-ingestion#:~:text=Data%20ingestion%20is%20the%20process%20of%20collecting%2C%20importing%2C,accurate%2C%20and%20comprehensive%20data%20for%20reporting%20and%20decision-making. well that is all this url is used for is ingesting data. i blocked the whole domain now and have no problems playing any programs or ads on multiple devices (on an ad supported plan) hoping we can block the whole subdomain as this subdomain also appears in apps and smart tvs ### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
As I see, the mentioned custom filter can be addressed [here](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/HostlistsRegistry/issues?q=sort%3Aupdated-desc+is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen).

> Because of a new change or some limit reached, Adguard now complains that I have reached the 30,000 max limit of rules that can be applied. I have no way to fully apply the oisd.nl rule anymore.

That's the MV3 limits. You can use [our app](https://adguard.com/adguard-windows/overview.html) instead of the extension.

I have no way to fully apply the oisd.nl rule anymore. ### Screenshots

issue.title: www.weatherzone.com.au

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

comment.body: For anyone confused on how to make tinyShield work, edit the installed Tampermonkey script to have `// @match        *://*.weatherzone.com.au/*` added into the list.

comment.body:
As far as I understand, these domains are related to Brave Rewards (which is disabled by default) - https://github.com/brave/brave-browser/wiki/Brave-Ads-Endpoint:-non-Brave-Rewards-users and I guess that blocking it might cause breakage if a user enables it.

Is this domain used to load/display ads on other pages (not related to Brave Rewards)?

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [NSFW] [https://www.redgifs.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.redgifs.com%2F) ### Comment > Integration issue on Reddit > > Steps to reproduce: > 1. Open NSFW subreddit, e.g. https://www.reddit.com/r/porn > 2. Click "Yes, I'm over 18" button > 3. Find any post with RedGIFs integration (Reddit doesn't host such images, so it's basically every post) > 4. Click "View NSFW content" button > > Actual result: > "Error loading this gif" message > > Expected result: > Content is displayed > > Comment: > The issue seems to be connected to enabled "network.https.filter.http3.enabled" setting in Advanced settings. If disabled, the content is loaded. On iOS the content is loaded despite having such filtering enabled by default. Please report to according teams if necessary ### [NSFW] Screenshots [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/98o9to1uipkws8g08cgwws0g0wwksggbajf6p04xr4.png?nc=1) [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/b4yf7gbgg88o488ww4c880coggogwgk7i8aj7d5z3c.png?nc=1) ### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Mac v2.18.0.2089 System version: | `macOS 26.2` Browser: | Safari Tracking protection: | disabled DNS filtering: | server: `AdGuard DNS (DNS-over-HTTPS)`

comment.body:
@Alex-302 
I'm using Edge's DNS settings. Have attached a video showing the issue.
1. Open Edge Settings
2. Navigate to "Privacy, search, and services" > "Security" 
3. Under the "Secure DNS" section, add a custom service provider `https://dns.adguard-dns.com/dns-query`
4. Attempt to access [uob.com.sg](http://uob.com.sg)
5. Notice it fails to load.

Note: I in the video closed the incognito tab to clear the cache after swapping back to AdGuard DNS. If I don't do that, a refresh will load the page successfully even though the DNS has been swapped back to AdGuard. All addons are disabled in incognito mode.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9ea042ca-292f-457c-a334-2330d650f80a

### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.lobandsmash.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.lobandsmash.com) ### Comment > 1. comment.body:
If I'm not wrong, redirection doesn't help much on my side. 

- If I `badfilter` other AS blocking rules to not cause breakages, redirection doesn't prevent further AS requests. Blocking and redirecting still yield the same results.
- Similarly, without further adjustments, blocking and redirecting still makes the sites broken for me.
